content.intro:
The city of a thousand and one faces invites you to an adventure filled with emotion.

Friendly, exuberant, festive and cultural… Those are just a few MOTS to give you a taste of the atmosphere that awaits you on a trip to this must-see spot of North-Eastern Brazil, or Nordeste in Portuguese. Fortaleza is among the largest metropolises in the country with a population of more than 2.3 million. Indeed, its dynamic demographic growth attests to the city's attractiveness.
The history of this ancient fortress also illustrates the interest sparked by Fortaleza, as far back as the early 16th century. In successive waves, explorers from all over the world have mingled with natives, creating the cosmopolitan city that you will see today. Feel the warmth, the hospitality and the pleasant atmosphere all along your journey. This joyous melting pot will take you along a musical adventure to the tunes of samba and forro, the traditional music and dances of Brazil.
You can stroll through downtown's colourful streets, pass by the modern skyscrapers on the shore, practice extreme sports, take beach trips to the east and west and spend nights in one of many trendy clubs and bars. Architecture fans and theatre aficionados will discover the Theatro José de Alencar, while those who love cultural outings will lose themselves in the vast Dragão do Mar art centre. To recover from all the frenzy, travel to Jericoacoara and enjoy precious moments of relaxation.
Whether you are hyperactive or laidback, athletic or meditative, Fortaleza is the perfect destination for anyone who loves to invent their vacations day by day. The city is also an excellent launching pad for adventures to the other treasures of the sublime Ceará Coast, from Jericoacoara to Canoa Quebrada, with their luxuriant landscapes, dunes in every direction and omnipresent musicality.
Some vacations create lifelong memories and this one will undoubtedly be among them.

content.title: Moleskine Gastrobar, meet up spot of the trendy youth

introduction.small: In Fortaleza's Aldeota neighbourhood, Moleskine Gastrobar is at once a bar, a restaurant and a wine cellar.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Moleskine Gastrobar, meet up spot of the trendy youth

paragraphs.text:
Spanish tapas, Chilean wine, European beer and Peruvian ceviche… Moleskine Gastrobar's cuisine is primarily defined by a fusion of inspirations from around the world. In a laidback and chic setting that functions both as bar and restaurant, the Brazilian youth crowd in for a drink, a bistronomical meal or simply to listen to music.
Each area of Moleskine Gastrobar offers a different atmosphere. Depending on your mood, choose the cosy “street bar” with pallet-based sofas and yellow pillows, or the “loft” and its street art frescoes, for intimate dining in a neo-industrial setting. Unless you'd prefer the “rooftop” and its incredible panoramic view of the city, or the “lounge” to listen to some jazz, comfortably seated in a leather armchair. And last but not least, the “wine cellar” will take you on an oenological journey. This is an original way to gather several night time activities into one!

content.title: In harmony with nature at Rancho do Peixe

introduction.small: On the Atlantic coast, only a few miles from the Jericoacoara National Park, Rancho do Peixe is a haven of peace surrounded by coconut trees.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: In harmony with nature at Rancho do Peixe

paragraphs.text:
Near the Jericoacoara National Park, a 200,000 sqm coconut plantation hides about twenty bungalows in its midst. These small houses have been arranged like a fishing village by the heavenly Preá beach. Built using reforestation wood and carnauba straw that are typical from the region, they have been decorated with craftsmanship and local care, setting the tone for your experience at Rancho do Peixe.
The establishment bets on ecotourism and strives to reduce its ecological footprint. In this light, the organic garden supplies the beach restaurant with produce. The bungalows will allow you an intimate and relaxing stay close to nature. Thrill-seekers will be able to kitesurf in one of Brazil's greatest spots. For those you crave more calm and peace, yoga classes are organised facing the ocean, and you can order a massage on your private terrace. An invitation to find yourself, no matter what you expect of life.

content.title: A relaxing moment around lunch at Atlantidz

introduction.small: On the very pleasant Praia do Futuro, spend your day at this restaurant for a taste and fun experience.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: A relaxing moment around lunch at Atlantidz

paragraphs.text:
At Atlantidz, lay back in the shade of coconut palms, with your feet in the sand, the lapping waves in the background with music in the air.
The restaurant has a swimming pool, a small water activity park for children and loungers under thatched umbrellas. Much more than a beach shack, you will be drawn to this space dedicated to idleness, swimming and simple pleasures. Refresh yourself with the juice of a freshly opened coconut. Then choose among the many fish or seafood dishes: mariscada – a traditional dish made from rice, seafood and fish, lobster or crab. For dessert, choose the Pudim de leite, the famous Brazilian custard. Delicious and fun, you won't soon forget Atlantidz.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Rediscover relaxation at Hotel Long Beach

paragraphs.text:
If paradise exists, you will find it in this seaside resort of Canoa Quebrada at Hotel Long Beach. Just 350 metres from the beach, this little gem offers ideal peace and relaxation. Set down your suitcases in this charming place and let yourself steep in serenity. The spacious rooms are perfectly equipped and a gym, massage room and everything you need for your well-being are also provided. The staff is caring and at your service. Try out a horse ride or a buggy adventure. Jump into the pool, the centrepiece of this peaceful haven, for long hours of relaxation or try out the bed-like loungers and hammocks while listening to a live orchestra in front of the water.

content.title: Trendy and rhythmic nights in Fortaleza

introduction.small: There is nothing like the bars and nightclubs of Fortaleza to end an evening on a high note! In Brazil, parties never stop and you can dance until the early hours of the morning.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Trendy and rhythmic nights in Fortaleza

paragraphs.text:
In Fortaleza, life is in full swing, day and night! After some sunbathing at the beach, head downtown to the Dragão do Mar art and culture centre. Near Almirante Jacegui street, you will run into the trendy youth of the city, meeting at Orbita Bar for a night of fun. Here the blue and pink spotlights brighten the crowds in constant movement, and artists come regularly to this hot spot of Fortaleza.
Have a cocktail at the bar or head to one of the billiard tables for a joyful competition in an underground atmosphere. A dozen kilometres away, one of the most famous nightclubs of the city welcomes partygoers in several different atmospheres: here at the Mucuripe Club, every floor has its own music. Soul, electro and other vibes will keep you going all night long.

content.title: Jericoacoara, an Eden at the end of the world

introduction.small: Between palm trees, surfers and white sand, this mythical place on the Brazilian coast is waiting for you!

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Jericoacoara, an Eden at the end of the world

paragraphs.text:
Less than 300 kilometres from Fortaleza, Jericoacoara is a true paradise, very sought after by thrill seekers! Athletes looking for an adrenaline rush line up at the kitesurfing schools to rent their equipment. Slightly calmer but just as appreciated, windsurf boards are also available. If the traditional charm of the place attracts you, discover the old fishing village that has made this place famous. A real curio for tourists around the world, the village of “Jeri” has not lost its authenticity. Stroll through the white sand lanes and breathe in the delicious ocean air. After a pleasant walk, visit the Jericoacoara Dune to admire the beautiful sunset over the Atlantic. The blazing colours of this spectacle will leave you speechless!

content.title: In harmony with nature at Parque Ecológico do Cocó

introduction.small: A few steps away from the bustling city centre, take a break at Fortaleza's most popular park, actively fighting to save endangered species.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: In harmony with nature at Parque Ecológico do Cocó

paragraphs.text:
Less than seven kilometres from the sea, “Cocó Park” is one of the largest parks in South America. Opened in 1989, it is a giant oasis of greenery in the very heart of the city. With a total surface area of ​​nearly 1,100 hectares, the green lung of Fortaleza is home to a gigantic mangrove, this tropical marine marsh ecosystem that produces a lot of biomass. Many plant and animal species flourish here: molluscs, crustaceans, fish, reptiles, birds and mammals, some of which are endangered.
The behaviours of some of the park fauna are studied by scientists to understand why they are endangered. The trees found here are also an effective means of combating pollution in this urban environment. Enjoy an eco-friendly boat trip along the Rio Cocó: you can admire the flora and fauna that populate the environs.

content.title: Pousada Araxá, the jewel of Jericoacoara

introduction.small: Discover the splendour of Jericoacoara with a hotel that celebrates the sun in all its glory.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Pousada Araxá, the jewel of Jericoacoara

paragraphs.text:
This hotel marvellously carries its name since Araxà means “the place where we can always follow the sun” in a native language. This is exactly the stand of Pousada Araxà, with its privileged setting for those in love with light. Most apartments, 9 out of the total of 15, have private terraces that will literally allow you to follow the sun from sunrise to sunset. What could be more tempting than making the most of a tasty breakfast with an exceptional view over the Jeri dunes and rows of palm trees? Perhaps giving in to laziness in the Jacuzzi on this same terrace.
And if the ocean view gives you an irresistible need for a swim, jump into your suit and cross the hot sand. It's just 50 metres to the beach and the water.

content.title: Sunbathing at Canoa Quebrada

introduction.small: Visit this dreamlike spot for a sunny escape, two hours away from Fortaleza. Put on your suit and explore!

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Sunbathing at Canoa Quebrada

paragraphs.text:
Just south of Fortaleza, this trendy seaside resort is one of the main destinations in the State of Ceará. If it was a hippy outpost in the 1970s, you can roam on sumptuous beaches today. Expect white sands, ocean stretching as far as you can see and surfers riding its waves. In the evening, walk along Broadway and rub shoulders with locals in small restaurants on this mythical street of Canoa Quebrada. For sports, you can try out kitesurfing, paragliding or even the buggy if you haven't done that yet. Whatever the season, this spot is one of the trendiest of Northeastern Brazil! You'll love the friendly atmosphere and the idyllic nature of this unique place.

content.title: Mercado Central, land of the artisans

introduction.small: Save some room in your suitcase because you won't leave empty-handed.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Mercado Central, land of the artisans

paragraphs.text:
First built in wood in 1809 to welcome butchers, fruit and vegetable stands and fish mongers, the original building has since given way to a very modern version, dedicated to original crafts for the pleasure of bargain hunters. This is the main market of Northeast Brazil, and a required stop for many visitors. This shopping haven will meet your every desire with its stands overflowing with a thousand and one temptations, from regional produce such as spices, manioc and fruits to clothing, jewellery and other items. Prolong the taste of your Brazilian vacation with a bottle of cachaça (alcohol made with Brazilian sugar cane) then spoil your entourage at home with your mastery of caipirinhas (the famous cocktail with a base of cachaça mixed with sugar and lime). Stock up on pareos, leather sandals and baskets and taste some tropical fruit, Brazilian nuts and cashew nut spread. Everything you need for some great gifts for family and friends is right before you!

content.title: Athletic escapades a few steps from the sea

introduction.small: Water activities are not the only outdoor options in the Fortaleza area. In addition to kitesurf and windsurfing, enjoy buggies and bikes for a change of pace.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Athletic escapades a few steps from the sea

paragraphs.text:
All throughout the year, Fortaleza offers many sporting opportunities for thrill-seeking globetrotters. Only 20 kilometres from downtown, reserve your buggy excursion to Cumbuco. Aboard these famous all-terrain vehicles, you can find secret little corners of paradise that can't be reached by car. Head out to the sand dunes for exotic landscapes and an even more intense experience!
To travel through town, bikes remain a pleasant alternative to walking. Jump on the saddle of your two wheeler and explore the streets of Fortaleza. To discover local culture and make the most of a superb view of the ocean, nothing beats a bicycle outing. Finally, if you prefer hikes, you can walk along the beach and admire the horizon that spreads out before you while breathing in the sea air.

content.title: Heaven as a beach!

introduction.small: Get out your bathing suits and make the most of the coast near Fortaleza. Whatever your agenda, your days will be filled with dips in the sea.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Heaven as a beach!

paragraphs.text:
The beaches around Fortaleza are endless, but they don't all look alike. La Praia do Futuro, to the east of the port, is an invitation to relaxation. This beach has kept its authenticity, especially with charming canvas parasols! If you don't want to lie down for too long, you can surf or windsurf as the wind here makes it an ideal spot. If you like motorsports, you'll love discovering the dunes and lagoons of Cumbuco, 35 kilometres from Fortaleza, on a buggy trip.
Lovers of postcard settings, stop at Lagoinha, 120 kilometres from Fortaleza. It is undeniably one of the gems of the region, with coconut palm trees spreading out as far as the eye can see.
Continue your exploration of the region and venture to Mundau, 140 kilometres from Fortaleza, a charming fishing village that has retained its traditional vibe. Take a boat trip to admire the wonderful sunset and have dinner in one of the small restaurants where you can enjoy delicious seafood…

content.title: Beach Park: ready for the high dive?

introduction.small: Rediscover your inner child with the largest water park in Latin America and test your limits!

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Beach Park: ready for the high dive?

paragraphs.text:
Your next stop is at Beach Park, just 16 kilometres from Fortaleza. Whether with family or friends, this is THE must-see spot of your trip. Between family attractions and extreme excitement, there is something for everyone. The little ones can roam around and play without risk in the Noah's Ark activity area with waterfalls, ramps and other amusing animations. Grown-ups and teens can enjoy one of the seven water slides of Ramubrinkà and its 25-metre high tower. Thrill seekers can push their limits with the vertiginous Insano and a 41-metre free fall at 105km/h. And if your nerves are still intact, climb onto a four-person water raft to go round and wound down the Vaikuntudo slide, the world champion of the “Tornado” category. Don't be afraid of getting wet!

content.title: Historical visit of downtown

introduction.small: Put beaches and parties on hold for a journey to the centre of Fortaleza.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Historical visit of downtown

paragraphs.text:
Stroll through the charming streets with their colourful houses and historical monuments for a very pleasant discovery. Architecture fans, head towards the José de Alencar theatre, a jewel of Art Nouveau architecture inaugurated in 1910. Its colourful stained glass windows and wrought iron staircases as detailed as lace will dazzle you. Make the most of a guided tour to truly feel the enchantment of the stunning interiors. You can even attend one of numerous shows: theatre, music or dance are all on the calendar.
Next, head off to the Praça da Sé. You may experience some déjà vu when seeing this magnificent basilica. Indeed, Georges Mounier was inspired by the surprising mixture of gothic and Romanesque architectures of the world-famous Chartres Cathedral, 80 kilometres southwest of Paris. Admire the splendour of the stained glass and the cupola above all.
To conclude this little adventure, look for the Ponte dos Ingleses to enjoy a romantic sunset. This sublime landing terrace was built in 1902 by order of the English, (hence the name) with materials directly imported from London. It then served as a port for 20 years.

content.title: Dragão do Mar: in the land of knowledge

introduction.small: If you like to learn about the arts, don't miss this out-of-the-ordinary art centre.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Dragão do Mar: in the land of knowledge

paragraphs.text:
Arouse your curiosity in this totally atypical downtown complex. Dragão do Mar offers visitors a broad choice of educational activities and entertainment. Among those: concerts, exhibitions, a planetarium and cinemas, with a rich and varied calendar of events.
Admire the works of well-known Brazilian sculptors such as Antonio Malta Campos, Bárbara Wagner, Gilvan Samico and Wilma Martins in the contemporary art museum, or dream about the conquest of the stars at the planetarium. You can also learn about the history of the region in a dedicated area. Use the elevated passages of this architectural structure to navigate between half a dozen buildings, and walk among the various restaurants and workshops along the way. Who knows, you may just run into one of tomorrow's top artists by chance. Art lovers, don't look elsewhere, this is the place for you!

Both simple and elegant, the rooms can welcome up to four people in incomparable comfort. Every morning, you will love your breakfast with fresh fruit, hot and cold drinks and pastries. mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: El Chancho, food truck extraordinaire

Head to one of the trendiest places in town to taste pork and various other meat specialties at a food truck! While the main ingredient of the recipes remains the same, you'll enjoy options that vary with the seasons. El Chancho brings together gourmets who will be tempted by a pulled pork sandwich or the perfect hamburger. Away from the beach, you can savour your snack in a hipster atmosphere, mingling with street food lovers for an experience rich in flavours and encounters. Comfort, elegance, and style are to be expected in each of the ten rooms and suites of Hotel Gran Marquise. Indulge in grilled prawns with coconut milk or any of the other delicious and exotic options.
With its high clear brick walls, Coco Bambu has a vintage look. Sit on the terrace of this charming address in Fortaleza to enjoy some aperitifs or daydream in front of a cocktail. content.title: CLIMATE AND WEATHER IN Fortaleza
content.introduction: Climate in Fortaleza is rather constant. The temperature range is small and close to 27°C (80°F) all year long. Water temperature also remains steady with an average 25°C (77°F). October to January are the hottest months (31°C/88°F on average). It is however recommended to avoid Fortaleza between March and May, when the rainy season is at its maximum.

airports.title: Fortaleza Pinto Martins International Airport
airports.description:
The Fortaleza Pinto Martins International Airport is located about 8 kilometres (5 miles) from the city centre.
  • One terminal

Getting from the airport to Fortaleza and back:
  • By car
    • Accessible via road BR 116 or Avenida Senador Carlos Jereissati. About 20 to 30 minutes of travel time in each case.
    • A parking facility with 848 places is available right across from the terminal (BRL 14 for 1 hour, BRL 45 for 1 day).
    • Several car rental companies have counters in front of the terminal.
  • By bus
    • Public bus lines 404, 66 and 27 connect the airport to the city centre of Fortaleza. One departure every 15 minutes between 5:00 a.m. and 11:00 p.m. It is recommended to avoid using the night bus. About BRL 3.20 for a one-way ticket and 40 minutes of travel time.
    • Express bus line 917 connects the airport with the Beira Mar avenue. Cost of a one-way ticket is about BRL 10.
  • By taxi
    • Taxis are located in front of arrivals. They connect the airport to the city centre for BRL 42 to 60 and 20 to 30 minutes of travel time.
  • Services: shops, bars and restaurants, free Internet access (Wi-Fi) available in the airport.
  • Telephone: +55 (0)85 3392 1200
  • Website: https://www.aeroportofortaleza.net/en/

medical.description: See your doctor before you travel. It is also recommended to take out insurance covering medical expenses and repatriation before your trip. Fortaleza counts several hospitals and medical institutions, as well as quality medical practitioners and health specialists.

essentialPhrases.title: Essential phrases
essentialPhrases.introduction: Here are a few basic Brazilian Portuguese phrases that will make your stay in Fortaleza a little easier:
phrases: Hello / Good morning / Good afternoon: Bom dia (morning) / Boa tarde (afternoon)
What time is it ?: Que horas são ?
Where can I find (…)?: Onde é que há (…)?
Where can I buy (…)?: Onde posso comprar (…)?

localCalendar.title: FESTIVALS, HOLIDAYS AND OTHER ANNUAL EVENTS IN Fortaleza
localCalendar.description: There are a number of festivals, holidays and other events celebrated in Fortaleza each year. The main ones are listed below.

events.title: February: Carnival (local event)
events.description: Fortaleza's carnival is among the most famous in the Nordeste, even though it is not as old as Olinda's and Salvador de Bahia's. For two days, parades take place all over town and gather several thousands of people.

events.title: May 22: Corpus Christi (national holiday)
events.description: This springtime commemoration of the Holy Eucharist was introduced by the Portuguese. This is an all-day affair in Fortaleza, with processions of children dressed in white, streets covered in sawdust and the creation of multicoloured rugs.

events.title: September 7: Independence Day (national holiday)
events.description: Brazil's independence in 1822 is celebrated in Fortaleza with concerts and shows, street parties, dances and a fireworks display late in the evening.

events.title: November 2: All Souls' Day (Dia de Finados, national holiday)
events.description: On this day, families gather to pay tribute to the departed and decorate their tombs at the cemetery.

events.title: December 2: National Samba Day - celebrated nationwide -
events.description: This day celebrating Brazil's most popular dance form also marks the official start of the summer holidays. As in other cities across the country, it is celebrated in Fortaleza with numerous samba performances, concerts and revellers dancing in the streets.

administrativeProcedures.title: Entry requirement for Brazil
administrativeProcedures.description:
As a French citizen, you do not need to obtain a visa if you will be visiting Brazil for less than 90 days. Your passport must be valid for at least six months from the date of entry and you must be in possession of an onward or return ticket.
If you hold dual Brazilian and French citizenship, you will be subject to Brazilian law from the moment you enter Brazil and until your departure. For this reason, if you are a dual national, you will need to present your Brazilian passport to enter and leave Brazil.
To enjoy peace of mind during your stay in Fortaleza and Brazil, be sure to check with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in your home country for the latest travel information and recommendations. Comprehensive information that may be helpful for international visitors is also provided on the Brazil page of the French Ministry of Foreign Affairs’ website:
view information for travellers to Brazil

goodToKnow.tips:
Tipping
In Fortaleza as in the rest of Brazil, a 10% service charge is included in the bill at bars and restaurants. However, it is customary to leave a little extra tip if you are particularly pleased with the service.
